text: Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven on medium-high heat. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 400degreesF.
Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Place skin side down in the Dutch oven and crisp the skin.
Chop the garlic coarsely and add to the Dutch oven when you flip the chicken. Cook another 3 or 4 minutes on this side.
Add half the broth to the Dutch oven, cover, and place in the oven for 20 minutes or until the chicken is 160degreesF.
Take the Dutch oven out of the oven and return to a burner. Remove the chicken and set aside. Add remaining 2 cups of broth plus 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil.
Chop the kale coarsely, and add that to the Dutch oven and cover for about 3 minutes to wilt it into the boiling liquid.
Add pasta, cook as directed, until al dente.
Let cool. Serve pasta in a bowl and top with parmesan. Float a chicken thigh on top and serve.
